answer: As well as some of very scenic areas mentioned by Mark Mayo there is the Aqua Dome in Tralee Co. Kerry a . It's basically a small indoor waterpark swimming pool. It could be a suitable afternoon activity if you want to give the little one something fun and the weather is rainy.
subtitle: I am planning a visit with my daughter 2 years and wife around Ireland and Northern Ireland for ten days. We start from Cork and finish in Dublin. What are the most interesting places to visit? In particular we are not interested in stuff not suitable for children night life etc and we would prefer to see something different from that in the UK and the rest of Europe. We have a Rough Guide but I found it almost impossible to figure out what is really worth seeing. I would be grateful for any suggestions. EDIT Regarding historic sites usually mostly outdoor sites are OK it's just the museum type sightseeing is too boring for the little one.
title: What are Ireland's top places to visit with a toddler?
